title: Neon hearts Valentine single-page surprise for Shivani

requirements.summary: Render the single-page Valentine prompt for Shivani with exactly two choices labeled "yess" and "i dont like you" in a responsive layout.
acceptanceCriteria: The main prompt includes the name "Shivani" and asks "Will you be my Valentine?".
There are exactly two visible options labeled exactly "yess" and "i dont like you" (matching casing/spelling).
The page is usable on iPad Chrome with responsive layout (no horizontal overflow).

file_operations.description: Ensure the displayed prompt text matches exactly "Shivani,\nWill you be my Valentine?" (including newline intent), keep exactly two visible buttons with labels exactly "yess" and "i dont like you", and verify the layout remains responsive without horizontal overflow on iPad Chrome.
Confirm/adjust global styles to prevent horizontal overflow (e.g., keep overflow-x hidden) and maintain readable neon typography on iPad-sized viewports.

requirements.summary: Create a full-viewport animated neon hollow-heart background with dozens of hearts floating upward in a pink-and-white neon palette on a dark romantic backdrop.
acceptanceCriteria: The background covers the full viewport behind all content.
At least dozens of small outlined (hollow) hearts animate upward continuously and loop seamlessly.
The color palette is predominantly neon pink and white on a dark romantic background so the outlines glow clearly.

file_operations.description: Tune the canvas heart system to ensure full-viewport coverage and a continuous seamless loop with at least dozens of small hollow outlined hearts, using a neon pink/white palette with clear glow against a dark romantic gradient.
Verify the NeonHeartsBackground component is rendered behind all content (single-page) and remains full-viewport across both the prompt and success states.

requirements.summary: Make the animated hearts background interactive for both mouse and touch/pointer input while preserving upward motion.
acceptanceCriteria: Pointer movement (mouse/pointer) influences hearts near the pointer in a noticeable way (e.g., repulsion and/or glow intensity increase).
Touch interaction on iPad produces the same visible effect as pointer movement.
Hearts continue to drift upward even while being interacted with.

file_operations.description: Ensure pointer interactions (including touch on iPad via pointer events) visibly affect nearby hearts (repulsion/drift and/or glow changes), and confirm the upward floating animation continues during interaction (including press/touch scenarios).

requirements.summary: Make the "i dont like you" button evade hover and tap/press, staying within viewport and avoiding the "yess" button area so "yess" remains reliably clickable.
acceptanceCriteria: Hovering over the "i dont like you" button makes it move away before a click can occur.
Attempting to tap/press the "i dont like you" button on touch devices also moves it away.
The "i dont like you" button never moves off-screen and does not overlap the "yess" button area when it relocates.

file_operations.description: Harden the evasive positioning logic to always keep the button fully within the viewport and reliably avoid overlapping the "yess" button area, including on iPad viewport sizes and orientation changes.

Wire evasive behavior to both desktop hover and touch/pointer press attempts so the "i dont like you" button moves before it can be clicked/tapped, while keeping the "yess" button above and reliably clickable.

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "yess" switches the page to a success screen/state.
The success screen shows a meme image and the caption text exactly "Hehehe Good gurl ðŸ˜šðŸ’—".
The success screen keeps the romantic neon styling consistent with the rest of the page.

Verify the success view shows the meme image and the caption text exactly "Hehehe Good gurl ðŸ˜šðŸ’—", and keep the neon romantic styling consistent (layout, glow, spacing) across device sizes.

requirements.summary: Include the required generated meme image as a static frontend asset and render it directly without any backend fetch.
acceptanceCriteria: A static image file exists at `frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-meme.dim_1200x800.png`.
The success view renders the image by referencing the static asset path (not via backend calls).

file_operations.description: Add the generated static meme image asset at exactly frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-meme.dim_1200x800.png so it can be served directly by the frontend.

Ensure the success meme image is rendered by directly referencing the static asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-meme.dim_1200x800.png (no backend calls), and that it scales responsively (no overflow on iPad).
